DataElement.preferredName: Barrett's Esophagus Segment Biopsy Zone Low Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number used to represent the low value of the biopsy collected from the barrett's esophagus zone segment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to the removal and pathologic examination of Esophageal segments lined with columnar metaplastic epithelium which is flat or villiform.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Esophageal segment lined with columnar metaplastic epithelium which is flat or villiform.  Barrett's epithelium is characterized by two different types of cells: goblet cells and columnar cells.  The symptomatology of Barrett's esophagus is that of gastro-esophageal reflux.  It is the precursor of most esophageal adenocarcinomas.  (WHO, 2000) -- 2003:One of the parts into which something naturally divides.:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: Esophageal lesion lined with columnar metaplastic epithelium which is flat or villiform. Barrett epithelium is characterized by two different types of cells: goblet cells and columnar cells. The symptomatology of Barrett esophagus is that of gastro-esophageal reflux. It is the precursor of most esophageal adenocarcinomas.  (WHO)
One of the parts into which something naturally divides.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: An area or region distinguished from adjacent parts by a distinctive feature or characteristic.

Concepts.definition: An area or region distinguished from adjacent parts by a distinctive feature or characteristic.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A minumum numerical level measured or assigned or computed of the Esophageal segment lined with columnar metaplastic epithelium which is flat or villiform.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Esophageal segment lined with columnar metaplastic epithelium which is flat or villiform.  Barrett's epithelium is characterized by two different types of cells: goblet cells and columnar cells.  The symptomatology of Barrett's esophagus is that of gastro-esophageal reflux.  It is the precursor of most esophageal adenocarcinomas.  (WHO, 2000) -- 2003:One of the parts into which something naturally divides.:A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree or intensity or amount.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Barrett epithelium is characterized by two different types of cells: goblet cells and columnar cells. The symptomatology of Barrett esophagus is that of gastro-esophageal reflux. It is the precursor of most esophageal adenocarcinomas.  (WHO)
One of the parts into which something naturally divides.
A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
